materials.raw_text: Cs: 30 g, Na: 20 g, Nb: 80 g, P: 10 g

sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online store specializing in rare elements. Na: Obtain sodium metal from a chemical supplier. Nb: Source niobium powder from a metallurgy supply company. P: Buy phosphorus from a chemical supplies retailer.
steps: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online store specializing in rare elements. Na: Obtain sodium metal from a chemical supplier. Nb: Source niobium powder from a metallurgy supply company. P: Buy phosphorus from a chemical supplies retailer.

1. Measure out 30 g of cesium (Cs), 20 g of sodium (Na), 80 g of niobium (Nb), and 10 g of phosphorus (P). 2. In a fume hood, carefully cut sodium into small pieces and set aside. 3. In a clean, dry container, combine the Cs, Nb, and P powders. 4. Slowly add the sodium pieces to the container while continuously mixing. 5. Use a mortar and pestle to ensure a homogeneous mixture.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 30 g of cesium (Cs), 20 g of sodium (Na), 80 g of niobium (Nb), and 10 g of phosphorus (P). 2. In a fume hood, carefully cut sodium into small pieces and set aside. 3. In a clean, dry container, combine the Cs, Nb, and P powders. 4. Slowly add the sodium pieces to the container while continuously mixing. 5. Use a mortar and pestle to ensure a homogeneous mixture.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a crucible made of alumina. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Set the furnace to heat to 800°C. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a crucible made of alumina. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Set the furnace to heat to 800°C. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Ensure that the crucible remains undisturbed during the cooling process to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Ensure that the crucible remains undisturbed during the cooling process to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or surface imperfections. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces if necessary. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and appearance. 5. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling the material.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or surface imperfections. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces if necessary. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and appearance. 5. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling the material.
